elements.title: Gowan Pamphlet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1772, Gowan Pamphlet (pictured) was ordained while still a slave?

elements.title: Speak Now World Tour – Live (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Taylor Swift said that her first live album, Speak Now World Tour – Live, was meant to capture what she wanted to "show [...] my kids and my grandkids"?

elements.title: Rockstar New England (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rockstar New England is based in Andover, Massachusetts, because it is the founder's "favorite place"?

elements.title: a 1990 amendment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the constitution of Arkansas contained text opposing racial integration for 34 years until it was repealed in a 1990 amendment?

elements.title: did not actively participate in the Holocaust (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while the Empire of Japan did not actively participate in the Holocaust, it has been found to have committed war crimes of its own?

elements.title: Helmut Reimer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Helmut Reimer, who was professor of microelectronics at the Technische Universität Ilmenau from 1971, began in 1992 to make TeleTrusT a competence centre for applied cryptography and biometrics?

elements.title: BMX XXX (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the concept of adding strippers to the extreme sports video game BMX XXX was initially proposed in jest?

elements.title: snowflake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that you can keep a snowflake in a browser tab?
